issues.brexitEurope: Our place in Europe - negotiating Brexit
issues.economy: Vote to properly fund the NHS, Social Care and Education and for investment in our economy, transport and energy.
issues.education: Vote to share funds allocated to grammar and free schools to education for all children as a first step to fair funding.
issues.health: Vote to properly fund the NHS, Social Care and Education.
issues.labourEmployment: Vote to introduce rent controls, to increase the minimum wage to £10, to abolish zero-hour contracts and to introduce universal free school meals.
issues.socialWelfare: Vote to guarantee the triple lock on the state pension. Vote to abolish the bedroom tax and tuition fees and against income tax increases for those earning below £80,000 a year.

community.content: significant local issues – such as: a lack of affordable and social housing; a badly clogged up and painful to use road system; an overloaded Hospital and local Health Centres; a railway line that is crying out for new investment, while the HS2 line will pass through and have no benefit to any of us locally; and a town centre that is in desperate need of pedestrianisation.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm a retired Primary School Headteacher, whose family all live within the town. I have as much of a vested interest in how it develops and the opportunities it provides to all of us, young and old, as anyone else living here. I am not a career politician and I firmly believe in the benefits of having a Constituency MP fully focused on our most significant local issues.

quotes.text: Having been born in and lived in Aylesbury for the whole of my life, I know the town and the Constituency of Aylesbury very well indeed.

examples: to increase the minimum wage to £10

a lack of affordable and social housing; a badly clogged up and painful to use road system; an overloaded Hospital and local Health Centres; a railway line that is crying out for new investment, while the HS2 line will pass through and have no benefit to any of us locally; and a town centre that is in desperate need of pedestrianisation.
Our place in Europe - negotiating Brexit
